paragraphs.content: Psalm 71
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 71

paragraphs.content: In thee, O LORD, do I put my trust: let me never be put to confusion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In thee, O Lord, do I put my trust: let me never be put to confusion.

paragraphs.content: Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: incline thine ear unto me, and save me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: incline thine ear unto me, and save me.

paragraphs.content: Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress.

paragraphs.content: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.

paragraphs.content: For thou art my hope, O Lord GOD: thou art my trust from my youth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou art my hope, O Lord God: thou art my trust from my youth.

paragraphs.content: By thee have I been holden up from the womb: thou art he that took me out of my mother’s bowels: my praise shall be continually of thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By thee have I been holden up from the womb: thou art he that took me out of my mother’s bowels: my praise shall be continually of thee.

paragraphs.content: I am as a wonder unto many; but thou art my strong refuge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am as a wonder unto many; but thou art my strong refuge.

paragraphs.content: Let my mouth be filled with thy praise and with thy honour all the day.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let my mouth be filled with thy praise and with thy honour all the day.

paragraphs.content: Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.

paragraphs.content: For mine enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together,
paragraphs.contentHtml: For mine enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together,

paragraphs.content: Saying, God hath forsaken him: persecute and take him; for there is none to deliver him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Saying, God hath forsaken him: persecute and take him; for there is none to deliver him.

paragraphs.content: O God, be not far from me: O my God, make haste for my help.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O God, be not far from me: O my God, make haste for my help.

paragraphs.content: Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and dishonour that seek my hurt.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and dishonour that seek my hurt.

paragraphs.content: But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more.

paragraphs.content: My mouth shall shew forth thy righteousness and thy salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My mouth shall shew forth thy righteousness and thy salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.

paragraphs.content: I will go in the strength of the Lord GOD: I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will go in the strength of the Lord God: I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.

paragraphs.content: O God, thou hast taught me from my youth: and hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O God, thou hast taught me from my youth: and hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works.

paragraphs.content: Now also when I am old and grayheaded, O God, forsake me not; until I have shewed thy strength unto this generation, and thy power to every one that is to come.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now also when I am old and grayheaded, O God, forsake me not; until I have shewed thy strength unto this generation, and thy power to every one that is to come.

paragraphs.content: Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high, who hast done great things: O God, who is like unto thee!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high, who hast done great things: O God, who is like unto thee!

paragraphs.content: Thou, which hast shewed me great and sore troubles, shalt quicken me again, and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou, which hast shewed me great and sore troubles, shalt quicken me again, and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the earth.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.

paragraphs.content: I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, O my God: unto thee will I sing with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, O my God: unto thee will I sing with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.

paragraphs.content: My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.

paragraphs.content: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long: for they are confounded, for they are brought unto shame, that seek my hurt.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long: for they are confounded, for they are brought unto shame, that seek my hurt.
